isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - ASSEMBLE - CHECKING THE ROTATING RESISTANCE OF THE DIFFERENTIAL ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: CHECKING THE ROTATING RESISTANCE OF THE DIFFERENTIAL ASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Specification: 50 ft-lbs. (67 Nm) maximum torque applied to one side gear.

note.para: Use a suitable tool for checking the rotating resistance of the differential assembly. The tool can be made from an axle shaft that matches the spline size of the differential side gear ( Figure 94).

figure.caption: Figure 94. Use Suitable Tool for Checking Rotating Resistance

step1.para: Install soft metal covers over the vise jaws to protect the ring gear.
Put the differential and ring gear assembly in the vise.
Install axle shaft tool into the differential until the splines of the tool and one side gear are engaged ( Figure 95).

figure.caption: Figure 95. Install Axle Shaft Tool into Differential

step1.para: Attach a torque wrench to the nut of the tool and rotate the gears in the differential case. When the gears rotate, read the value indicated on the torque wrench ( Figure 96).

figure.caption: Figure 96. Read Value Indicated on Torque Wrench

step1.para: If the torque value exceeds the specification of 50 ft-lbs. maximum (68 Nm), separate the halves of the differential case. Check the following for damage:

item.para: Thrust Washers (damaged or extra thrust washers may be the most common cause.)

step1.para: After the parts are repaired or replaced, assemble the main differential case and repeat steps 1-5 of this procedure. Use new Dri-Loc fasteners or apply Rockwell Liquid Adhesive 2297-C-7049 (Loctite #680) to the fastener holes in the case halves for the main differential.
